## The Challenge

**Understanding regional economic disparities in Italy**

- Income inequality varies significantly across regions and provinces
- Data is scattered across ISTAT databases
- Static reports fail to show trends over time
- Difficult to compare Liguria with neighboring regions

**Solution needed:**
A tool to visualize and explore income patterns interactively

## How Much Did Liguria Grow?
```{r echo=F, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# Liguria regional income data (2014-2024)
liguria_income <- c(24500, 24800, 25100, 25600, 26000, 
                    26400, 25800, 27200, 27900, 28500, 29200)
years <- 2014:2024

# Calculate total growth
initial_income <- liguria_income[1]
final_income <- liguria_income[length(liguria_income)]
total_growth <- ((final_income - initial_income) / initial_income) * 100

cat("Liguria Income Growth (2014-2024):\n")
cat("2014: â‚¬", initial_income, "\n")
cat("2024: â‚¬", final_income, "\n")
cat("Total Growth: +", round(total_growth, 1), "%\n", sep="")
cat("Average Annual Growth: +", round(total_growth / 10, 1), "%\n", sep="")
```

**Result:** Liguria's income per capita grew by **`r round(total_growth, 1)`%** over the decade!

## Which Province Leads Liguria?
```{r echo=F, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.height=3.5, fig.width=8}
library(ggplot2)

# 2024 Income data for Liguria provinces
provinces_2024 <- data.frame(
  Province = c("Genova", "Imperia", "Savona", "La Spezia"),
  Income_2024 = c(30100, 27400, 28800, 29000)
)

# Find the leader
leader <- provinces_2024[which.max(provinces_2024$Income_2024), ]
cat("Highest income province:", leader$Province, "with â‚¬", leader$Income_2024, "\n")

# Visualize
ggplot(provinces_2024, aes(x = reorder(Province, Income_2024), y = Income_2024, fill = Province)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  geom_text(aes(label = paste0("â‚¬", format(Income_2024, big.mark=","))), 
            hjust = -0.1, size = 5) +
  coord_flip() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("#E41A1C", "#377EB8", "#4DAF4A", "#984EA3")) +
  labs(title = "Liguria Provinces Income Comparison (2024)", 
       x = "", y = "Income per Capita (â‚¬)") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +
  theme(legend.position = "none", plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", hjust = 0.5)) +
  ylim(0, 32000)
```

## Why Use This App?

**Real-time comparative analysis:**
```{r echo=F}
# Compare Liguria with neighboring regions (2024)
regions_2024 <- data.frame(
  Region = c("Liguria", "Piemonte", "Emilia-Romagna", "Toscana", "Lombardia"),
  Income = c(29200, 29800, 32000, 28600, 34100)
)

# Rank regions
regions_ranked <- regions_2024[order(-regions_2024$Income), ]
liguria_rank <- which(regions_ranked$Region == "Liguria")

cat("Regional Income Rankings (2024):\n")
for(i in 1:nrow(regions_ranked)) {
  cat(i, ". ", regions_ranked$Region[i], ": â‚¬", 
      format(regions_ranked$Income[i], big.mark=","), "\n", sep="")
}
cat("\nLiguria ranks #", liguria_rank, " out of 5 regions\n", sep="")
```
